name: Dwarf Orchid Cactus
description: Epiphyllum pumilum is a small, epiphytic cactus native to Central America. Unlike typical desert cacti, this species grows in tropical forests as an epiphyte on trees. It features flattened, leaf-like stems (cladodes) that are green and slightly serrated along the edges. The plant produces beautiful, large flowers that are typically white or cream-colored and open at night. It's a compact species that's well-suited for terrariums where it can be mounted on wood or grown in a well-draining substrate. The plant thrives in high humidity and filtered light, making it ideal for closed terrarium environments.
careTips: Provide bright, indirect light - avoid direct sun
Allow substrate to dry slightly between waterings
Well-draining, organic-rich mix (orchid bark, sphagnum moss)
Can be mounted on wood or grown in substrate
